title: [Large-Scale] Blended Learning Design for Culturally Adapted Social Welfare Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Social Welfare Theory and Basic Understanding of Cultural Diversity
context.additional_context: Emphasis on learning activities using AI tools (e.g., chatbots, mobile-optimized LMS) in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, operating with formative assessments reflecting cultural contexts

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and compare three or more social work practice cases considering cultural contexts in blended learning environments
Learners can design social welfare education content that evaluates cultural applicability using AI-based tools.
Learners can propose social welfare intervention strategies reflecting cultural differences through collaborative online discussions (based on the CoI framework).

resources: Culturally Contextualized Social Welfare Case Database
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
